column4: My mouse is messed up. Right-click grabs a window (does not click in it), center-click resizes it (does not paste), etc. This after a 3 year old decided to help out. Anyone have any ideas how to get back to normalcy?
Checked, with xev and  xinput. No keys are reported as "down"
Hm.. have you tried checking xev and xinput for the mouse itself?
Do you have another computer you can compare them to?
I can fish out a laptop I think.
I'll try that and pop back in if I still can't figure it out.
what do you see on the screen?

when it's blank. I had a problem like that on one of my laptops with the nvidia driver, alt-sysreg-b did not work, but I could ssh in. Otherwise the machine looked dead. It was a dual GPU setup though. Any of this sound familiar?
And you've tried to remove and regenerate the xorg.conf (backing it up of course) in recovery mode?
I've even had success rotating with xrandr
Maybe the hack here is to put xrandr into your startup applications under gdm. I don't have any better suggestions now.
Not sure, but you can add an entry in /etc/sudoers to allow just xrandr to be run by your user with NOPASSWD.
